WorkItem.Description: It would be very useful to be able to do something like this : "#{myvar}" and like Coffeescript : http://coffeescript.org/#strings

Comments.Message:
Thanks for the suggestion.   This is something we'll be considering for future updates.  It is generally inline with supporting more of the ECMAScript 6 capabilities - and in particular those that can be compiled to simple and clean ES3/ES5.

In areas where there is overlap with ECMAScript6 proposals, we are generally adopting (and recommending improvements if needed) the approach used in ES6.  In this case, the "quasis" (now called "string templates") feature aims to address these use cases: http://wiki.ecmascript.org/doku.php?id=harmony:quasis

Specifically:
var myvar = "bob";
var s = `Hello ${myvar}`

This can also be used for multi-line strings:
var s2 = `Hi, 
how are you?`
Some of this will come along with aligning with more ES6 features in the future.  Setting it for after the 1.0 release.

would have loved it to be a part of 1.0 
Multi line strings _alone_ are something that are quite commonly required and would be just awesome to have early.
String Interpolation would be wonderful indeed!
